      • getNativeLibraryNames

        @Nullable
public String[] getNativeLibraryNames()
        Get native library names.

        Ignite Hadoop Accelerator executes all Hadoop jobs and tasks in the same process, isolating them with help of classloaders. If Hadoop job or task loads a native library, it might lead to exception, because Java do not allow to load the same library multiple times from different classloaders. To overcome the problem, you should to the following:

        • Load necessary libraries in advance from base classloader; LifecycleBean is a good candidate for this;
        • Add names of loaded libraries to this property, so that Hadoop engine is able to link them;
        • Remove System.load(String) and System.loadLibrary(String) calls from your job/task.
          • *
        Returns:
        Native library names.

      • setNativeLibraryNames

        public HadoopConfiguration setNativeLibraryNames(@Nullable
                                                 String... libNames)
        Set native library names. See getNativeLibraryNames() for more information.
        Parameters:
        libNames - Native library names.
        Returns:
